titleStmt.title: Decisions [199-200 AD]
titleStmt.author: Septimius Severus, Roman emperor between 193 and 211 AD

msContents.summary: Transcripts of imperial decisions which were posted in the Stoa of the Gymnasium of Alexandria; the decisions were rendered by Septimius Severus in the name of himself and Caracalla

msItemStruct.note: The papyrus had originally some imperfections, which explains the spacing between some letters
The decisions were posted on March 14, 200 AD
The original document represented in lines 22-24 was written in Latin
Perhaps the transcript was made for official purposes; it is possible, however, that it was a memorandum made by a notary for his own use

The body of the text was written by a capable professional scribe with many ligatures; the copyist did not take down the names and titles of the two Augusti, and a second scribe crowded them in later on in small letters

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 17 July 1930; no. 1 in Bell's inventory
